# Getting Started

This guide will help you set up your Lifeline device for first-time use. Follow these steps carefully to ensure proper operation.

## Prerequisites

Before starting, ensure you have:
- Assembled Lifeline device (see [Assembly Guide](assembly.md))
- Fresh μPAD cartridges
- Blood collection supplies (lancets, alcohol wipes)
- Mobile device with Bluetooth
- Calibration solutions

## Initial Setup

### Step 1: Power On
1. Press and hold the power button for 3 seconds
2. Wait for the startup sequence
3. Verify the display shows "Lifeline Ready"
4. Check battery level indicator

### Step 2: Bluetooth Pairing
1. Open the Lifeline mobile app
2. Enable Bluetooth on your device
3. Tap "Connect Device" in the app
4. Select your Lifeline device from the list
5. Confirm pairing when prompted

### Step 3: Initial Calibration
1. Insert the calibration μPAD
2. Follow on-screen calibration prompts
3. Wait for calibration to complete
4. Verify calibration success message

## First Measurement

### Step 1: Prepare Sample
1. Clean your finger with alcohol wipe
2. Use lancet to prick finger
3. Collect 10-15 μL of blood
4. Apply blood to μPAD sample zone

### Step 2: Insert Cartridge
1. Open cartridge holder
2. Insert μPAD with blood sample
3. Close holder securely
4. Wait for "Sample Detected" message

### Step 3: Run Assay
1. Select desired biomarker from menu
2. Press "Start Analysis"
3. Wait for 3-5 minute analysis
4. Review results on display

## Understanding Results

### Result Display
- **Numerical Value**: Measured concentration
- **Unit**: Standard units (mg/dL, mEq/L, etc.)
- **Status**: Normal/High/Low indicator
- **Timestamp**: When measurement was taken

### Reference Ranges
| Biomarker | Normal Range | Units |
|-----------|--------------|-------|
| Glucose | 70-100 | mg/dL |
| Creatinine | 0.6-1.2 | mg/dL |
| Urea (BUN) | 7-20 | mg/dL |
| Potassium | 3.5-5.0 | mEq/L |
| Albumin | 3.4-5.4 | g/dL |

### Result Interpretation
- **Normal**: Value within reference range
- **High**: Above upper limit
- **Low**: Below lower limit
- **Error**: Measurement failed

## Data Management

### Viewing Results
1. Open Lifeline app
2. Navigate to "Results" tab
3. Browse historical measurements
4. Filter by date or biomarker

### Exporting Data
1. Select desired results
2. Tap "Export" button
3. Choose format (CSV, PDF)
4. Share or save file

### Backup and Sync
1. Enable cloud sync in app settings
2. Choose backup frequency
3. Verify data synchronization
4. Monitor storage usage

## Maintenance

### Daily Maintenance
- Clean device surface
- Check battery level
- Verify Bluetooth connection
- Test with control sample

### Weekly Maintenance
- Calibrate optical system
- Update firmware if available
- Clean cartridge holder
- Check for software updates

### Monthly Maintenance
- Deep clean device
- Replace worn components
- Update calibration curves
- Review performance metrics

## Troubleshooting

### Common Issues
- **Device won't turn on**: Check battery, try charging
- **Bluetooth not connecting**: Restart device and phone
- **Inaccurate readings**: Recalibrate device
- **App not responding**: Force close and restart

### Error Messages
- **"Sample Error"**: Check μPAD insertion
- **"Calibration Required"**: Run calibration sequence
- **"Low Battery"**: Charge device
- **"Connection Lost"**: Re-pair Bluetooth

## Safety Guidelines

### Blood Collection
- Use sterile lancets
- Clean skin thoroughly
- Dispose of sharps properly
- Follow universal precautions

### Device Handling
- Keep device clean
- Avoid water exposure
- Store in dry location
- Handle μPADs carefully

### Disposal
- Dispose of μPADs in biohazard container
- Recycle device components properly
- Follow local disposal regulations

## Next Steps

After completing setup:
- Read the [User Manual](user-manual.md) for detailed procedures
- Review [Safety Guidelines](safety.md) for important precautions
- Check [Troubleshooting](troubleshooting.md) for common issues
- Explore [Research Applications](research.md) for advanced use
